I mean, yeah, it's a bit feminine, but the thing is - I just don't care! I love the smell of this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="797454"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=797454#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent774793" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc774793" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jromas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/950069"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.950069.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jromas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-9828.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9828.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus"title="Aventus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma774793ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd774793" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/950069">Jromas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-12-27">12/27/16 13:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wasn't thrilled when I was initially sprayed with this at the Ford counter, but the sales rep insisted. I left the store, got in my car and started smelling the most heavenly scent radiating from me. I instantly started putting on more from the decant that she had provided me and it lasted for most of my shift at work. It smells pretty feminine in my opinion but I can't get enough of smelling this on me. It's one of those feel good scents that you kind of even want to put on at home sitting around, going to bed, etc just to smell it. Love this fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="774793"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=774793#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent764888" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc764888" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Soofiya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/982196"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.982196.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Soofiya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Valentino/Valentino-Donna-31411.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31411.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Valentino Donna"title="Valentino Donna"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma764888ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd764888" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/982196">Soofiya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-11-27">11/27/16 07:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is not my type of perfume,I mean I'd never even try it according it's notes if a website didn't gift me a free sample of it,but now that I've tried it I can't stop smelling myself <br />
If you're looking for something loud or strange it would definitely disappoint you,but if you're looking for something soft and heavenly gorgeous that's it<br />
If angel's velvety wings had a smell,I'm sure it would smell like this,at least in my imaginations.if you have a baby child and you want a light perfume and you want he/she reminds your scent as momy's angelic scent give white suede a try.it can also be a great sleep-time perfume.I know it may seem too expensive for that usage but I believe there's nothing more pricey than happiness and sweet dreams.and I promise you that you're partner can't sleep without your silky,dreamy scent after a while.it's also a very good office fragrance <br />
I usually don't like leathery scents but suede is very silky here.I can also detect musk,amber and sandalwood,very well blended to produce a warm,soft,clean and soothing scent.it's one of those your own skin but better scents and I can't find any sharpness here<br />
Longevity is almost good but sillage is soft<br />
It's simply lovely <br />
</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="764888"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=764888#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent761873" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc761873" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="landshark321"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/888664"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.888664.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="landshark321" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma761873ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd761873" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/888664">landshark321</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-11-17">11/17/16 05:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tom Ford White Suede is definitely more my speed than Ombre Leather 16, which just provided a leather-centric accord that is less daring and interesting than Tuscan Leather.<br />
<br />
White Suede, by contrast, is a leatehr/floral blend that has quite a unisex appeal.  Suede is still the main standout, with contributions from rose, saffron, tea, and amber.<br />
<br />
I'm not sure why but it comes off powdery on my skin, a powdery leather floral bit that while walking the unisex line nicely nonetheless comes off as a little feminine, as many powdery fragrances do, and I'd say that this is more exaggerated due to leathers usually being among the most masculine-leaning fragrances.<br />
<br />
Performance seems adequate, perhaps slightly better than Ombre Leather 16 but not as good as Tuscan Leather.<br />
<br />
FragranceX has this at under $170 so it's on the secondary market at a significant discount from the current retail standard of $225, but I'm not sure I'd spring for a bottle due to the powdery aspect. Still, overall, a pleasant fragrance and a nice softer, unisex alternative to Tuscan Leather.<br />
<br />
7 out of 10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="761873"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=761873#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent754066" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc754066" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ChristopherRiley"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/66399"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.66399.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ChristopherRiley" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Stayin-Alive-36108.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.36108.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Stayin' Alive"title="Stayin' Alive"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma754066ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd754066" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/66399">ChristopherRiley</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-21">10/21/16 07:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A musky suede feminine mid-mature fragrance, which sits close to the skin and is linear...<br />
<br />
I applied 6 heavy sprays<br />
<br />
0-1.5 hours 2 inch projection. This fragrance is very feminine and not very complex.  It is suede with heaps of musk and slightly posh. It could be used during day or night, has a corporate work feel, and could be used at a formal occasion.<br />
<br />
1.5 hours - 3 hours- 1 inch projection. Very close to skin. Pretty much linear, but if you smell hard enough you can get some floral and although not listed some little leather<br />
<br />
3 hours - 24 hours. This stayed on my skin until the next day but very close to the skin and no projection<br />
<br />
Very forgettable<br />
<br />
Not for me</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="754066"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=754066#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent745152" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc745152" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PinkRainbow"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/983272"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.983272.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PinkRainbow" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Donna-Karan/Liquid-Cashmere-Blush-51319.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51319.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Liquid Cashmere Blush"title="Liquid Cashmere Blush"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma745152ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd745152" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); Silky suede and spices woven within a sharp amber vibe.  Great for a winter's night with snow falling.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="745152"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=745152#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent735191" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; the sandalwood is the predominant note in the drydown.  The earlier phases are harder to describe, other than just to say I smelled really good.  Lasted at least 6 hours with moderate-strong sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="735191"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=735191#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent728010" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc725263" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wootforDOLCE&amp;GABBANA"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005486"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="wootforDOLCE&amp;GABBANA" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6386.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Suede"title="White Suede"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma725263ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd725263" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005486">wootforDOLCE&amp;GABBANA</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-07-20">07/20/16 16:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the first 30 min smelled like department store lotion...then an expensive leather wallet appeared and stayed there. <br />
<br />
(maybe i'm just mulling over the fact that this perfume is so dang expensive if I were to invest in a bottle...)<br />
<br />
a great 5/5 stars non-fragrance fragrance! Its the kind of fragrance where people can't tell if you've sprayed something on or not (assuming you don't spray on too much)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="725263"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=725263#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent701960" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc701960" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LuxAestiva"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/984343"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.984343.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LuxAestiva" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ermenegildo-Zegna/Mediterranean-Neroli-34030.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34030.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mediterranean Neroli"title="Mediterranean Neroli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma701960ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd701960" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/984343">LuxAestiva</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-05-03">05/03/16 00:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favorite private blends. If you're into leather/suede but Tuscan Leather is too intense and masculine, then try White Suede. Basically new car smell meets white flowers, clean musk and a touch of smoke. The dry down is like a musky, clean shampoo but still smells expensive and comforting. I only wish the suede/leather stayed around longer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="701960"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=701960#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent699463" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc699463" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="beritskagen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/189431"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.189431.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="beritskagen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma699463ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd699463" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/189431">beritskagen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-24">04/24/16 11:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tom Ford scents seems to usually have some basic similarities about them, so no wonder its listed a bunch of other TF scents that "people who like also like". However it's not very informative when researching, especially for anybody that doesn't have a TF counter nearby. So I got the chance to finally smell this, and it surely reminded me of something, but I could not put my finger on it...and suddenly it struck me: Noa by Cacharel! Of course. I have not smelt them side by side, and they probably would differ quite a bit, but if I where to choose a TF fragrance for a person who love Noa, I would go for this one.  This is musk covered in suede rather than coffee leaving it soft soft and beautiful just like Noa....They share a composition of powdery transparency, but TF WS is more stated and collected and does not hide as silently in the air, its more pronounced than Noa. <br />
<br />
In my opinion this might be one of the TFs that is a bit easier to wear. This composition seems to work in a (clean enough?) way that people will know its your perfume they are smelling rather than think; what is that odd odor...? To some of us that is rather reassuring. Some of the TFs flirts a bit with the cumin note, and that can sometimes make the perfume smell somewhat like a curry rather than something you would want to wear. This one stays clear of that, but still has kept the Tom Ford signature. (You might want people to be able to smell that price tag I guess...) Its not for the shy, but for the one that knows that there is no need to be loud or act out in weird ways to be heard. Its beautiful, clean, interesting and  rather safe at the same time. It just calmly and politely stands out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="699463"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=699463#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="6386" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent371038" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc371038" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jackcrew"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/252141"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.252141.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jackcrew" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma371038ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd371038" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/252141">jackcrew</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-05-27">05/27/13 18:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have been on a search for a musk. While walking through Saks, I purchased a bottle of Kiehl's original musk and the sales lady guided me over to Tom Ford where I tried White Suede.  This fragrance baffles me.  <br />
<br />
It seems to operate on two levels of the brain.  The surface level says "no big deal."  It is a basic fresh/clean smell that truly does smell like a store full of expensive leather jackets or purses.  Nice, but nothing special.<br />
<br />
But this musk also operates on a deeper level of my brain (the primitive, animal part near the amygdala).  This is the part of the brain sometimes associated with emotion and feelings. White Suede Musk activates this section greatly. First, I just cannot pull my wrist away from my nose in order to stop sniffing.  Secondly, I want my life to smell like this. I want my home, car, clothes, and my skin to smell this good.<br />
<br />
For some reason, when I wear this scent my life seems richer, happier, more satisfying. It makes me wonder why this is not the most popular smelling fragrance in the world - doesn't everyone want to smell like this?<br />
<br />
Then the upper level of the brain takes over and says, "it isn't anything special; hence few people buy it."  <br />
<br />
So, White Suede Musk by Tom Ford is really nothing special in regards to the fragrance world. It is pleasant, clean and simple in many ways.  You will find many scents that are more beautiful and worth the money.  But I will buy this musk and wear it as much as possible because for me, it operates on a primitive level and invokes great joy and happiness in my mind.  And that makes it so worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="371038"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=371038#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1875799" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1875799" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="silthrill"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1449134"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1449134.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="silthrill" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65738.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orphon Eau de Parfum"title="Orphon Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1875799ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1875799" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1449134">silthrill</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-10">07/10/23 18:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sexy ashtray vibes. This is one of those fragrances that I shouldn't like but I actually love, and that make me question what happened in my formative years to cause me to like this. It's a little smokey, a little leathery, a little powdery, a little musky. This is a more feminine version of F*cking Fabulous, but still unisex. It's for when you want to smell clean and dirty at the same time. Wholesome people won't like this. If you had a dysfunctional childhood then it's a 10/10. Full bottle worthy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="1875799"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=1875799#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent965887" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc965887" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="___lucas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1154169"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1154169.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="___lucas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Infusion-d-Amande-31044.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31044.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Infusion d'Amande "title="Infusion d'Amande "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma965887ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd965887" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1154169">___lucas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-27">07/27/18 06:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is pure sex.<br />
Not a powerful sexy bomb.<br />
But still, pure sex.<br />
<br />
The elegance of the scent reminds me of a wealthy, mature and indipendent woman.<br />
Her sexiness comes from her self consciousness: she doesnt need to show off her skin to become other peoples desire. Her clothes are very minimalistic, ton sur ton combinations, her makeup is barely there and she keeps her hair in a clean bun. Her bag is usually a taupe Kelly or a Phantom by Cline.<br />
<br />
You can detect her scent only if very, very close: are you lucky enough?<br />
<br />
Although the fragrance is labeled as a feminine scent, you should try the fragrance even if youre a man: in this case the sexiness comes from the contrast between the feminine elegance of the fragrance itself and the natural odor of a male skin. The result is not a clearly sex statement achieved by masculine fragrances such as Bel Ami or any other leather-patchouli-vetiver based scent: it is subtle and definitely more intriguing. Give it a try!<br />
<br />
PS: youre gonna love this if you come from Narciso, both For Her or Narciso (it works even if your Arab customer doesnt want anything smelling like Oud).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="965887"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=965887#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1111010" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1111010" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="1guy1dog3cats"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1149854"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1149854.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="1guy1dog3cats" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Jeux-de-Peau-11350.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11350.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jeux de Peau"title="Jeux de Peau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1111010ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1111010" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1149854">1guy1dog3cats</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-30">10/30/19 03:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow, wow, wow. I love White Suede. Chanels Cuir de Russie is a god-tier fragrance, and this feels like a modernized take on that classic. Both feature a powdery floral abstraction over an animalic base. Theres a skanky, smoky leather core in CdR, but here, thats swapped out for a creamy, buttery suede, reminiscent of an airier, fattier version of the leather note found in other Tom Ford scents. Its fresh but substantive, casually elegant, and in its own sly way, sexy as hell.<br />
<br />
When approaching the Tom Ford fragrance counter, youre greeted with a line that sprawls and sprawls. Some in the collection are roaring behemoths, attracting far more attention and cult reverence. Tune out that volume for this much tamer gem. White Suede purrs, poised to seduce those who favor subtlety over braggadocio. <br />
<br />
An absolute must-try for musk and leather fans too.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="1111010"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=1111010#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent441082" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc441082" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Germany"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/137168"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.137168.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Germany" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-Cologne-51692.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51692.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus Cologne"title="Aventus Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma441082ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd441082" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/137168">Germany</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-12-30">12/30/13 19:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>WHITHE SUEDE<br />
I love the musk and the clean aspect of the fragrance. Some days it smells of clean laundry to me, and mild soap and soft wash detergent,  other days I smell the suede aspect more so and I do enjoy that as well. Its warm and clean at the same time. Like a white suede jacket , soft and cozy , turns into a skin scent completely, smells better than skin, after all , suede IS skin :) <br />
 Update <br />
ThIs smells soooo good. Smells of suede for sure, what a genius fragrance. Equally gourgous on a man. Its very  classy yet quite casual At he same time. Understated elegance. It has the smell of a leather butique , new purses and new fine leather jackets , what a sexy skin scent. On the other hand it smells of clean / dirty laundry.  I smell sandalwood musk and saffron as well as suede. I can not detect the rest of the notes but they must , in combination ,do an amazing job in making this fragrance smell beautiful.<br />
Update , white suede is slowly becoming my very favourite perfume. It's not really like perfume it's just a really good musky smell and that's what I love about it. So it's not a statement fragrance or going out smell but rather a skin smell , its sexy and musky or as my friend says it smells of linen sheets , freshly pressed , I can see that , I love that !<br />
Some people think this is discontinued , but it's not. They changed the bottle from this to brown to go along with the other Tom Fords. As the rest of the musk line was discontinued they didn't want a lonely white cap soldier . It's more elegant in the dark bottle. And protects the juice better too.<br />
And my compliments to Jackcrew ( several reviews below) great review, agree with everything he wrote :) <br />
Sweetandspicy; amazing review !!! Feel exactly the same !!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="441082"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=441082#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="6386" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1110478" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1110478" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CaraQ"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1206755"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1206755.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CaraQ" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/OUAI/Melrose-Place-52552.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52552.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Melrose Place"title="Melrose Place"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1110478ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1110478" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1206755">CaraQ</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-28">10/28/19 08:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Talk about a multiple personality perfume. First spray - divine! It reminded me of something from childhood, and it was a wonderful something! Suede, sandalwood, amber and a slight hint of smokiness. <br />
<br />
Later in the afternoon?  OMG, help - Dirty. Ashtray. HOW is that even possible??? Truly, it was awful.<br />
<br />
Moral of the story - Get a tester for this baby.  Try it for a couple of days to see if it Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hydes on you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="1110478"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=1110478#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent159948" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc159948" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Grottola"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47939"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.47939.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Grottola" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma159948ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd159948" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47939">Grottola</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-06-26">06/26/11 07:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>White Suede, by Tom Ford, to my nose, simply smells like a leather (suede) purse with some clean laundry detergent musk.<br />
<br />
It's nice and pleasant, but would be better layered with something, or perhaps with more added to it to give it some structure.  A very nice and long-lasting suede note that's quite accurate, nonetheless.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="159948"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=159948#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent593390" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc593390" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wesleyhclark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/410918"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.410918.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wesleyhclark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alfa-Romeo-Perfumes/Black-70093.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70093.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black"title="Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma593390ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd593390" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/410918">wesleyhclark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-05-10">05/10/15 05:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Urged to try this one by somebody on this page's forum, I duly visted a Nordstrom for a paper strip and a spray.<br />
<br />
I was hoping for a sort of distant cousin to Tuscan Leather, which I like very much. Or perhaps some variation of a light white musk of the type found in Mugler Cologne. Anyway, that was the expectation. <br />
<br />
What I got was a sort of hard-to-define collection of notes that didn't make me think of either. Worse, it didn't play well with my skin chemistry, becoming rather sour or "off." There's a note there that is just not flattering or pleasant on me. <br />
<br />
What's more, it's very light. I'm a big guy... this is like wearing a tie made out of Kleenex. It just doesn't work. <br />
<br />
My wife didn't like it, either. It reminded her of a cheap musk that somebody she used to know used to wear.<br />
<br />
So... no. Not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="593390"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=593390#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1599676" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1599676" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AyeDeeBee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1385926"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1385926.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AyeDeeBee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dossier/Fruity-Almond-73740.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73740.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fruity Almond"title="Fruity Almond"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1599676ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1599676" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1385926">AyeDeeBee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-09">07/09/22 09:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wrap new pair of leather boots in plastic, put them in the microwave, and take them out right before they start smoking. Thats what this smells like to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="1599676"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=1599676#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1683639" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1683639" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aarix"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1579653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aarix" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Black-Line-18049.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18049.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Line"title="Black Line"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1683639ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1683639" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579653">Aarix</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-08">11/08/22 06:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What's denoted as tea and thyme in the top notes produce an unpleasant  "CIGARETTE ASH!" accord on my skin (maybe *discord* is more the word ), but thankfully that dies down eventually. Unthankfully the drydown smells like. Um. Well these are some very cloying powdery florals, and this is a very sexy kind of musk. I am presented with the vivid image of hooking up on a leather sofa with an upper-middleclass chainsmoking grandma. I mean--get it, granny!! but I don't really want to smell like this :(<br />
<br />
Edit: presented this to a non-fumehead friend with zero preamble (I like to let people have a look thru my collection of small decants) and it didn't smell like ash on her, though it remained just as stuffy. She was like "wow this smells like my grandparent's place :/" ...And apparently her mother even agreed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="6386"comment_id="1683639"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Tom-Ford/White-Suede-6386.html?ccid=1683639#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="6386" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="6386":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="6386" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300 __728x90" id="fragranticacom_perfume_footer" v-pre>

                 data-sticky

                <!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_vrec_1 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x600" id="fragranticacom_perfume_vrec_1" v-pre>
</div>
            </div>
                <div style="clear:both; height: 1rem;"></div>
    
</div>
    </div>
</div>                        <div id="popBrands" class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 4em;"><span>Most Popular Perfumes</span></div>
            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-y grid-margin-x text-center">
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Khamrah-75805.html" class="en2inter">Khamrah Lattafa Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">2.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

    let privateChannelName = "private-www-en-fr-1";

    let use_notifications = 0;
    let user_logged =  0;
    let user_id =  1;
    let xml_lang = "EN";
    let admin = 0;
    let moderator = 0;
    let image_perfumes_path = "https://fimgs.net/";

    //including script with vue like mfga-app.js
    let langVars = {
        now_i_wear: "Currently I am wearing",
        confirm_delete: "Do you really want to delete your comment?",
        submit: "Submit",

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
